definition: surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards

sentences.english: During the Jin dynasty, a boy, called Mao Bao, was born into an impoverished family.
sentences.chinese: 晋朝时，有一位名叫毛宝的小男孩，家境十分贫困。

sentences.english: Huangshan in the Jin dynasty, when Buddhism introduced, under the peak Regulus Regulus temple was built.
sentences.chinese: 佛教在晋朝时传入黄山，轩辕峰下曾建有轩­辕古刹。

sentences.english: D. 265-420), but the Jin could not long contain the invasions of the nomadic peoples.
sentences.chinese: 但是，晋朝并不能长期抵制游牧民族的入侵。

sentences.english: In Jin Dynasty, there was a person named Yue Guang, who always entertained his guests with wine.
sentences.chinese: 晋朝的时候，有一个叫乐广的人很喜欢请朋友喝酒。

definition: Song of the Southern dynasties 南朝宋 (420-479), with capital at Nanjing
Song of the Southern dynasties (420-479), with capital at Nanjing/also known as Liu Song 劉宋|刘宋
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
